block.p: Shari Claire Lewis and Thomas Joseph Veltre are to be married this evening by Rabbi Charles Agin at the Bronxville Women's Club in Bronxville, N.Y. The Rev. William Young, a Roman Catholic priest, is to take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 43, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a partner in Rivkin, Radler & Kremer, a law firm in Uniondale, N.Y. She received a bachelor's and a law degree from the State University at Buffalo. Her parents, Elaine Lewis of Linden Hill, Queens, and the late Paul Lewis, were owners of the Croyden Furniture Showrooms in Manhattan.

The bride, 43, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a partner in Rivkin, Radler & Kremer, a law firm in Uniondale, N.Y. She received a bachelor's and a law degree from the State University at Buffalo. Her parents, Elaine Lewis of Linden Hill, Queens, and the late Paul Lewis, were owners of the Croyden Furniture Showrooms in Manhattan.

The bridegroom, also 43, is the manager of media services for the Wildlife Conservation Society in the Bronx, the international conservation and research organization that operates the Bronx Zoo and four other New York zoos. He writes, edits and films wildlife documentaries for the society. He graduated from the Crane School of Music at SUNY College at Potsdam, N.Y., and is a doctoral candidate in communications at New York University.

He is a son of Eleanor and Rudolph Veltre of Poughkeepsie, N.Y. His mother retired as the audiovisual coordinator for Ketchum High School in Wappingers Falls, N.Y. His father retired as a programmer for I.B.M. in Poughkeepsie.
